## Description {#details}

This class stores info we want to provide to or retain within an alias query.

By default, the root query is stateless and starts with a freshly constructed info object. Specific alias analyses can use this query info to store per-query state that is important for recursive or nested queries to avoid recomputing. To enable preserving this state across multiple queries where safe (due to the IR not changing), use a <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a></code> wrapper. The information stored in an <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a></code> is currently limitted to the caches used by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicaa">BasicAA</a>, but can further be extended to fit other <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> needs.

Definition at line 238 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.

### MayBeCrossIteration {#ad146481f5f2cf1cad3e6174f4398ecbe}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::AAQueryInfo::MayBeCrossIteration = false">
Tracks whether the accesses may be on different cycle iterations.

When interpret &quot;Value&quot; pointer equality as value equality we need to make sure that the &quot;Value&quot; is not part of a cycle. Otherwise, two uses could come from different &quot;iterations&quot; of a cycle and see different values for the same &quot;Value&quot; pointer.

The following example shows the problem: p = phi(alloca1, addr2) l = load ptr addr1 = gep, alloca2, 0, l addr2 = gep alloca2, 0, (l + 1) alias(p, addr1) -&gt; MayAlias ! store l, ...

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00295">295</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### NumAssumptionUses {#aa8a0539d2cf9c0e654fb4390f657e28b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="int llvm::AAQueryInfo::NumAssumptionUses = 0">
How many active NoAlias assumption uses there are.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h/#l00274">274</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/aliasanalysis-h">AliasAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
